snippet: Calling interest in his taxes “small-minded,” Mitt Romney said he had looked at 10 years of returns, a response to Democrats who suggested he might have paid nothing in some years.
abstract: Mitt Romney says he paid at least 13 percent of his income in taxes each year during the past decade, again confronting a vexing issue that Democrats have used to portray him as out of touch with middle-class values; Romney's comments appeared to be an off-the-cuff attempt to put the issue behind him once and for all but they seem to have had the opposite effect, with Democrats seizing on them to revive the issue and demand proof of his claims.
lead_paragraph: Calling interest in his taxes “small-minded,” Mitt Romney said he had looked at 10 years of returns, a response to Democrats who suggested he might have paid nothing in some years.

headline.seo: Romney Says He Paid at Least 13 Percent in Taxes
headline.main: Romney Says He Paid at Least 13% in Income Taxes
headline.print_headline: Romney Says He Paid At Least 13% In Income Taxes
